original_title: Time Passed More Slowly By The Sea
overview: From his home in Lisbon, Lebanese-Palestinian writer Saleem Haddad reflects on memory, his family (who are spread across three countries) and the strangeness of the sea. He further elicits his grandmother’s fast-fading recollections of Palestine and considers the notion of writing about one’s birthplace from a distance.
title: Time Passed More Slowly By The Sea
